election_record.label: Massachusetts 1820 State Senate, Hampshire District

overview.note: "Whole number of votes, 7589. Necessary to make a choice, 3795." Governor's Council Records.

sub_unit.name: Greenfield
sub_unit.note: The Franklin Herald (Greenfield, MA) and the Hampshire Gazette (Northampton, MA) report 104 votes for Jonathan Dwight, Jr. and 108 for Elihu Hoyt.

sub_unit.name: Heath
sub_unit.note: Jonathan Dwight, Jr received 18 votes as Jonathan Dwight.
Jonathan H. Lyman received 18 votes as Jonathan Lyman.

sub_unit.name: Blandford
sub_unit.note: Jonathan H. Lyman received 3 votes as Jonathan Lyman.

sub_unit.name: Brimfield
sub_unit.note: The Hampden Federalist and Public Journal (Springfield, MA) reports 116 votes for each of the four candidates.

sub_unit.name: Springfield
sub_unit.note: Jonathan Dwight, Jr. received 5 votes as Jonathan Dwight.
Jonathan H. Lyman received 1 vote as Jonathan Lyman.

sub_unit.name: Wilbraham
sub_unit.note: Jonathan Dwight, Jr. received 3 votes as Jonathan Dwight.

sub_unit.name: Amherst
sub_unit.note: The Hampden Federalist and Public Journal (Springfield, MA) reports 230 votes for Jonathan H. Lyman and 127 for Mark Doolittle.
The Hampshire Gazette (Northampton, MA) reports 127 votes for Mark Doolittle.

sub_unit.name: Chesterfield
sub_unit.note: Jonathan Dwight, Jr. received 5 votes as Jonathan Dwight.
Jonathan H. Lyman received 6 votes as Jonathan Lyman.

sub_unit.name: Hatfield
sub_unit.note: Jonathan Dwight, Jr. received 18 votes as Jonathan Dwight.

election_record.reference: Governor's Council Records. Massachusetts State Archives, Boston.
Boston Town Records. Boston Public Library.
Hampden Federalist and Public Journal (Springfield, MA). April 5, 1820.
New-England Palladium and Commercial Advertiser (Boston, MA). April 7, 1820.
Hampden Federalist and Public Journal (Springfield, MA). April 12, 1820.
Hampden Federalist and Public Journal (Springfield, MA). May 17, 1820.
